Recipe.title: Candied tomatoes on basil leaves
Recipe.shortDescription: Recreate fine antipasto with all the favourites, then share them with a winning double of homemade dips.

directions.directionDescription:
Line a baking tray with baking paper. Remove the tomatoes
Unsure of the quantity needed?
Click on the underlined ingredient to reveal the quantity. No need to flip back and forth!
 (12 vine-ripened cherry truss tomatoes) from the vine, leaving the stalk attached. Place the sugar and 1/4 cup (60ml) water in a heavy-based saucepan and stir over low heat until the sugar dissolves. Increase the heat to medium and cook, without stirring, for 6-8 minutes until the sugar is a golden caramel. Remove from the heat.

Working quickly, hold a tomato by the stalk and carefully dip in the caramel to coat, then place on the tray and set aside for 2-3 minutes to harden. Repeat until all 12 tomatoes are covered in caramel.
To serve, arrange the basil leaves (12 basil leaves) on a platter, then top each basil leaf with 1 candied tomato.

Recipe.title: Rockmelon
Recipe.shortDescription: Refresh the classic ham-and-melon combo with a smear of citrus-flecked goat’s cheese.

directions.directionTitle: Combine the goat's cheese, orange rind and lemon rind in a bowl
Spread goat's cheese mixture over bread
directions.directionDescription: Spread goat's cheese mixture over bread. Top with prosciutto and rockmelon. Drizzle over the honey. Season with pepper and sprinkle with mint.

Recipe.title: Chicken and spinach dumplings
Recipe.shortDescription: These parcels deliver - and they're fun and easy to make!

directions.directionDescription: Rinse spinach under cold water. Drain. Place in a microwave-safe dish. Cover. Microwave on high (100%) for 1 to 2 minutes or until wilted. Place in a sieve. Drain excess liquid.

Place spinach, mince, garlic and soy sauce in a large bowl. Stir to combine. Place wrappers on flat surface. Spoon 2 teaspoons mince mixture on 1 half of each wrapper. Brush edges with cold water. Fold over to enclose filling. Press edges together to seal. Place on a tray lined with baking paper.
Place a steamer lined with baking paper over simmering water. Cook dumplings, in batches, for 15 minutes or until tender and cooked through. Serve.

Recipe.title: Chilli smoked salmon cob dip
Recipe.shortDescription: Take this old party favourite to another flavour dimension!

ingredients.ingredientName: Sweet chilli smoked salmon portion, flaked

directions.directionDescription: Place spinach in a microwave-safe dish. Microwave on HIGH (100%) for 1 to 2 minutes or until wilted. Squeeze out excess liquid. Roughly chop.
Place spinach, sour cream, cheese, onion and salmon in a bowl. Stir to combine.
Preheat oven to 180°C/160°C fan-forced. Using a serrated knife, cut 3cm from top of loaf. Set top aside. Cut bread from loaf cavity, leaving a 2cm border. Cut bread and bread top into 3cm pieces.
Place bread pieces and loaf on a large baking tray. Bake for 15 minutes or until golden and crisp. Spoon spinach mixture into loaf. Serve with toasted bread.

Recipe.title: Grilled seafood platter
Recipe.shortDescription: Luxe up your dinner party with this seafood platter rather than the usual antipasto.

ingredients.ingredientName: Blue swimmer crabs, halved, claws cracked
Lobster tails or small whole lobsters, halved, cleaned
Ripe avocados, peeled, stoned, roughly chopped

directions.directionDescription: Combine the oil, garlic, basil, lemon juice and zest in a bowl, then season. Brush the marinade over the seafood.

Heat a barbecue hotplate to medium-high. Cook the crab and lobster for 2 minutes, then add the scampi and cook for a further 2 minutes. Add the prawns and clams, and cook for 3-4 minutes, then add the scallops. When the clams open and the prawns and scallops are opaque, transfer all seafood to a platter. Serve with parsley, avocado and seafood sauces.
To make the avocado cream: Pulse ingredients in a food processor until smooth. Season to taste with sea salt and freshly ground black pepper.
To make the seafood sauce: Whisk the ingredients together. Season with salt and pepper.

Recipe.title: Bruschetta with mushrooms & crisp ham
Recipe.shortDescription: Celebrate the end of the growing season with this bountiful Autumn dish.

ingredients.ingredientName: Blue swimmer crabs, halved, claws cracked
Swiss brown mushrooms, stalks trimmed to 1cm

directions.directionDescription: Heat 2 teaspoons oil in a large ovenproof frying pan over medium heat. Cook ham, in 2 batches, for 30 seconds each side or until crisp. Transfer ham to a plate and reserve the pan.

Preheat a chargrill pan over high heat. Combine remaining 3 1/2 tablespoons oil with garlic in a bowl. Brush both sides of bread with the oil mixture, then chargrill, in 2 batches, for 2 minutes each side or until golden and charred.

While the last batch of bread is cooking, add butter and remaining oil mixture to the reserved pan and place over medium heat. Add mushrooms, cap-side down, and cook, spooning butter mixture over mushrooms, for 5 minutes. Turn mushrooms over and cook for a further 5 minutes or until tender. Add vincotto and parsley, and toss mushrooms to coat.

Cut each bruschetta in half and break each slice of ham into quarters. Top each toast with a piece of ham, a mushroom, some parsley from the pan, then another slice of ham. Drizzle pan juices over bruschetta to serve.
